meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jon Choi Greg Munda Varun Shekhar Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6735.

td.p: Jon Choi, a law student originally from Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
Greg Munda, a computer technician from Glendale, California
Varun Shekhar, a graduate student in engineering and law from Northville, Michigan (whose 2-day cash winnings total $18,600)

tr.td: ENCYCLOPEDIA BRITANNICA SAYS SO
HIGHWAYS & BYWAYS
LITERATURE
2013 CDs
HERBS & SPICES

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '"Its \'57 varieties\' slogan was devised in 1896, but today the company markets more than 5,700 products"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: "Its '57 varieties' slogan was devised in 1896, but today the company markets more than 5,700 products"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_4_2', 'clue_DJ_4_2_stuck', '(Jon: What is pizza?)
(Alex. No.)
...
(Alex: Where did pizza come from?)
(Jon: That\'s how they taught us to ski--[*] and french fries.)
(Alex: Oh, I see.)
[Jon\'s response was ruled incorrect, but this was reversed before Final Jeopardy! because "It turns out that the pizza can be a synonym for the [*] in skiing instruction."]

snowplow

Jon
')
